name: Middle-earth
description: The realm of J.R.R. Tolkien's legendarium, home to the Third Age and the War of the Ring. A vast continent populated by Elves, Men, Dwarves, Hobbits, and darker forces.

entities.name: Middle-earth
entities.summary: The great continent of Arda in the Third Age, home to Elves, Men, Dwarves, Hobbits, and the dark forces of Sauron. The setting for the War of the Ring.

entities.name: The Shire
entities.summary: A peaceful, rural land of rolling green hills and cozy hobbit holes in the northwest of Middle-earth, home to the Hobbits.

entities.name: Bag End
entities.summary: The luxurious hobbit-hole home of Bilbo and later Frodo Baggins, built into the side of the hill overlooking Hobbiton.

entities.name: Bree
entities.summary: A small town at the crossroads of the Great East Road and the Greenway, where Men and Hobbits live together.

entities.name: Rivendell
entities.summary: The Last Homely House east of the Sea, the hidden valley of Elrond Half-elven, a sanctuary for travelers.

entities.name: The Misty Mountains
entities.summary: A great mountain range running north-south, home to many dangers including Orcs, Goblins, and the Balrog of Moria.

entities.name: Moria
entities.summary: The ancient Dwarven kingdom of Khazad-dûm beneath the Misty Mountains, now abandoned and inhabited by Orcs and a Balrog.

entities.name: Lothlórien
entities.summary: The Golden Wood, realm of the Lady Galadriel and Lord Celeborn, protected by the power of the Elven Ring Nenya.

entities.name: Fangorn Forest
entities.summary: The ancient forest home of the Ents, the shepherds of trees, located at the southern end of the Misty Mountains.

entities.name: Isengard
entities.summary: The fortress of Saruman the White, built around the tower of Orthanc, later corrupted and used as a stronghold for his armies.

entities.name: Rohan
entities.summary: The land of the Horse-lords, a kingdom of Men between the Misty Mountains and the White Mountains, known for their skilled riders.

entities.name: Edoras
entities.summary: The capital city of Rohan, built on a hill and home to the Golden Hall of Meduseld, seat of the King of Rohan.

entities.name: Helm's Deep
entities.summary: The great fortress in the Deeping-coomb of Rohan, last refuge in times of war, site of the Battle of Helm's Deep.

entities.name: Gondor
entities.summary: The great kingdom of Men in the south, last bastion against the forces of Mordor, ruled from the White City of Minas Tirith.

entities.name: Minas Tirith
entities.summary: The White City, capital of Gondor, built on seven levels on the Hill of Guard, facing the shadow of Mordor.

entities.name: Osgiliath
entities.summary: The former capital of Gondor, now in ruins and fought over by Gondor and Mordor, straddling the River Anduin.

entities.name: Mordor
entities.summary: The dark land of the Enemy in the southeast, dominated by the volcano Mount Doom where the One Ring was forged.

entities.name: Barad-dûr
entities.summary: The Dark Tower, Sauron's fortress in Mordor, from which the Eye watches over Middle-earth.

entities.name: Mount Doom
entities.summary: Orodruin, the volcano in Mordor where the One Ring was forged and must be destroyed, the only place it can be unmade.

entities.name: The Black Gate
entities.summary: Morgul Vale and the main entrance to Mordor, heavily fortified and guarded by the forces of Sauron.

entities.name: Weathertop
entities.summary: Amon Sûl, the watchtower on Weathertop hill, where Frodo was wounded by the Witch-king.

entities.name: The Dead Marshes
entities.summary: A treacherous marshland on the border of Mordor, filled with the lights of the dead, where Gollum led Frodo and Sam.

entities.name: Cirith Ungol
entities.summary: The pass of the spider, a secret entrance to Mordor guarded by Shelob, where Frodo was captured by Orcs.

entities.name: Ithilien
entities.summary: The garden of Gondor, a fair land between the Anduin and the Mountains of Shadow, where Faramir encountered Frodo and Sam.

entities.name: Minas Morgul
entities.summary: The Tower of Sorcery, formerly Minas Ithil, now a stronghold of the Nazgûl and gateway to Mordor.

entities.name: Amon Hen
entities.summary: The Hill of Sight, the high seat on the southern end of Nen Hithoel, where Frodo used the Ring and the Fellowship was broken.

entities.name: Frodo Baggins
entities.summary: A Hobbit of the Shire, the Ring-bearer who undertook the quest to destroy the One Ring. Brave and resilient despite the Ring's terrible burden.

entities.name: Samwise Gamgee
entities.summary: Frodo's loyal gardener and companion, a Hobbit who never left his master's side throughout the quest. The true hero of the story.

entities.name: Meriadoc Brandybuck
entities.summary: Merry, a Hobbit of Buckland, brave and resourceful. Later became a Knight of Rohan and helped slay the Witch-king.

entities.name: Peregrin Took
entities.summary: Pippin, a Hobbit of the Took family, curious and impulsive. Later served as a Guard of the Citadel in Minas Tirith.

entities.name: Aragorn
entities.summary: Also known as Strider, the Dúnedain ranger who was the rightful heir to the thrones of Gondor and Arnor. Later crowned King Elessar.

entities.name: Legolas
entities.summary: Prince of the Woodland Realm of Mirkwood, an Elven archer of great skill and keen senses. Friend to Gimli the Dwarf.

entities.name: Gimli
entities.summary: Son of Glóin, a Dwarf of the Lonely Mountain, fierce warrior and friend to Legolas. Represented the Dwarves in the Fellowship.

entities.name: Boromir
entities.summary: Son of Denethor, Steward of Gondor, a valiant warrior who fell to the Ring's temptation but redeemed himself in death defending Merry and Pippin.

entities.name: Gandalf
entities.summary: The Grey Wizard, later the White, a Maia sent to Middle-earth to aid in the fight against Sauron. Returned from death as Gandalf the White.

entities.name: Gollum
entities.summary: Formerly Sméagol, a Hobbit-like creature corrupted by the One Ring over hundreds of years. Both guide and betrayer to Frodo.

entities.name: Elrond
entities.summary: Half-elven Lord of Rivendell, keeper of Vilya, one of the Three Rings. Called the Council of Elrond to decide the Ring's fate.

entities.name: Galadriel
entities.summary: Lady of Lothlórien, keeper of Nenya, one of the Three Rings. Possessed great wisdom and power, tested by the Ring's temptation.

entities.name: Saruman
entities.summary: The White Wizard, head of the Istari, who fell to evil and betrayed the free peoples. Ruled Isengard and bred Uruk-hai.

entities.name: Théoden
entities.summary: King of Rohan, freed from Saruman's spell by Gandalf. Led his people valiantly in the War of the Ring until his death at Pelennor Fields.

entities.name: Éowyn
entities.summary: Niece of King Théoden, shieldmaiden of Rohan. Defied orders to remain behind and slew the Witch-king of Angmar at the Battle of Pelennor Fields.

entities.name: Faramir
entities.summary: Captain of Gondor, son of Denethor and brother of Boromir. Resisted the Ring's temptation and later became Prince of Ithilien.

entities.name: Denethor
entities.summary: Steward of Gondor, father of Boromir and Faramir. Despair drove him to madness and suicide.

entities.name: Treebeard
entities.summary: Fangorn, the oldest of the Ents, leader of the Entmoot, who marched on Isengard to defeat Saruman.

entities.name: Shelob
entities.summary: A great spider, ancient and evil, who dwelt in the passes above Minas Morgul, near Cirith Ungol.

entities.name: Bilbo Baggins
entities.summary: Frodo's uncle, former Ring-bearer, who left the Ring to Frodo at his eleventy-first birthday party.

entities.name: The Balrog
entities.summary: A demon of fire and shadow, a Maia corrupted by Morgoth, who dwelt in the depths of Moria and fought Gandalf.

entities.name: The Witch-king of Angmar
entities.summary: Lord of the Nazgûl, the chief of the Ringwraiths, slain by Éowyn and Merry at the Battle of Pelennor Fields.

entities.name: Gríma Wormtongue
entities.summary: Saruman's spy in Rohan, counselor to King Théoden, who corrupted the king's mind with lies.

entities.name: The Fellowship of the Ring
entities.summary: The nine companions chosen at the Council of Elrond to destroy the One Ring: four Hobbits, two Men, one Elf, one Dwarf, and one Wizard.

entities.name: The Three Hunters
entities.summary: Aragorn, Legolas, and Gimli, who pursued the Orcs across Rohan to rescue Merry and Pippin after the Breaking of the Fellowship.

entities.name: The Two Walkers
entities.summary: Frodo and Sam, who continued the quest to destroy the Ring after the Fellowship broke apart, guided by Gollum.

entities.name: The White Council
entities.summary: A group of the Wise, including Gandalf, Elrond, Galadriel, and Saruman, formed to counter the threat of Sauron.

entities.name: The Rangers of the North
entities.summary: The Dúnedain, descendants of the Númenóreans who guard the northern lands of Eriador, led by Aragorn.

entities.name: The Rohirrim
entities.summary: The Horse-lords of Rohan, skilled riders and warriors who fight for the Free Peoples.

entities.name: The Stewards of Gondor
entities.summary: The ruling house of Gondor in the absence of a king, serving as caretakers until the return of the rightful heir.

entities.name: The Elves of Rivendell
entities.summary: The Elven folk who dwell in the Last Homely House, led by Elrond Half-elven.

entities.name: The Elves of Lothlórien
entities.summary: The Galadhrim, the Elven folk of the Golden Wood, led by Galadriel and Celeborn.

entities.name: The Ents
entities.summary: The ancient shepherds of trees, guardians of Fangorn Forest, who march against Isengard.

entities.name: The Forces of Isengard
entities.summary: Saruman's armies, including Uruk-hai, Orcs, and wild Men, servants of the White Hand.

entities.name: The Forces of Mordor
entities.summary: Sauron's vast armies of Orcs, Trolls, Nazgûl, and other evil creatures, the greatest threat to Middle-earth.

entities.name: The Long-Expected Party
entities.summary: Bilbo's eleventy-first birthday party in the Shire, where he disappeared using the Ring and left it to Frodo.

entities.name: Gandalf Reveals the Ring's Nature
entities.summary: Gandalf returns to the Shire and tells Frodo that his ring is the One Ring, and that he must leave the Shire.

entities.name: Flight from the Shire
entities.summary: Frodo, Sam, Merry, and Pippin leave the Shire, pursued by the Black Riders, taking the back roads to avoid them.

entities.name: Encounter at the Prancing Pony
entities.summary: Frodo and his companions meet Strider (Aragorn) at the inn in Bree, and Frodo accidentally puts on the Ring.

entities.name: The Attack on Weathertop
entities.summary: The Ringwraiths attack the company at Weathertop, and the Witch-king stabs Frodo with a Morgul-blade.

entities.name: The Race to Rivendell
entities.summary: Aragorn, with the wounded Frodo, races to reach Rivendell before the Morgul-blade reaches Frodo's heart, saved by Glorfindel.

entities.name: The Council of Elrond
entities.summary: The gathering in Rivendell where the fate of the One Ring was decided and the Fellowship was formed.

entities.name: The Journey through Moria
entities.summary: The Fellowship's dangerous passage through the abandoned Dwarven kingdom, where Gandalf fell fighting the Balrog.

entities.name: Gandalf's Fall
entities.summary: Gandalf's battle with the Balrog on the Bridge of Khazad-dûm, where both fell into the depths.

entities.name: The Fellowship Reaches Lothlórien
entities.summary: The remaining Fellowship, grieving for Gandalf, reaches the Golden Wood and meets the Lady Galadriel.

entities.name: Galadriel's Test
entities.summary: Galadriel shows each member of the Fellowship visions in her mirror and resists the temptation to take the Ring for herself.

entities.name: The Breaking of the Fellowship
entities.summary: The Fellowship was broken at Amon Hen when Boromir tried to take the Ring from Frodo, and Frodo decided to continue alone with Sam.

entities.name: The Uruk-hai Attack
entities.summary: The attack by Saruman's Uruk-hai at Amon Hen, where Boromir died defending Merry and Pippin, who were then captured.

entities.name: The Capture of Merry and Pippin
entities.summary: Merry and Pippin are captured by the Uruk-hai and carried across Rohan toward Isengard.

entities.name: Escape into Fangorn
entities.summary: Merry and Pippin escape from the Uruk-hai into Fangorn Forest, where they meet Treebeard.

entities.name: Gandalf's Return
entities.summary: Gandalf the White appears to Aragorn, Legolas, and Gimli in Fangorn Forest, having returned from death after defeating the Balrog.

entities.name: The Ride to Edoras
entities.summary: Gandalf, Aragorn, Legolas, and Gimli ride to Edoras to free King Théoden from Saruman's influence.

entities.name: Théoden's Healing
entities.summary: Gandalf drives out Saruman's influence from King Théoden, restoring him to strength and wisdom.

entities.name: The Entmoot
entities.summary: The gathering of the Ents in Fangorn Forest to decide whether to go to war against Saruman.

entities.name: The Battle of Helm's Deep
entities.summary: The epic defense of the fortress of Helm's Deep by the forces of Rohan against Saruman's army, ending with the arrival of Gandalf and the Huorns.

entities.name: The Fall of Isengard
entities.summary: The Ents' attack on Isengard, flooding the fortress and capturing Saruman, ending his threat.

entities.name: The Siege of Minas Tirith
entities.summary: Sauron's massive assault on the White City, the greatest battle of the War of the Ring, where the Witch-king was slain.

entities.name: The Battle of Pelennor Fields
entities.summary: The great battle on the fields before Minas Tirith, where the Rohirrim arrived and Éowyn slew the Witch-king.

entities.name: The Paths of the Dead
entities.summary: Aragorn's journey through the haunted mountain paths to summon the Army of the Dead to fulfill their oath.

entities.name: Pippin Looks into the Palantír
entities.summary: Pippin looks into Saruman's palantír, revealing himself to Sauron and forcing Gandalf to take him to Minas Tirith.

entities.name: Faramir's Retreat
entities.summary: Faramir leads a retreat from Osgiliath, pursued by the Nazgûl, and is wounded saving the rearguard.

entities.name: Denethor's Madness
entities.summary: Denethor, driven to despair by the palantír and Faramir's apparent death, attempts to burn himself and his son alive.

entities.name: The Ride of the Rohirrim
entities.summary: Théoden leads the Rohirrim on their great ride to Gondor, arriving at the critical moment of the battle.

entities.name: Frodo and Sam in Ithilien
entities.summary: Frodo and Sam encounter Faramir and his Rangers in Ithilien, where Faramir resists the Ring's temptation.

entities.name: The Journey through the Dead Marshes
entities.summary: Gollum leads Frodo and Sam through the treacherous Dead Marshes, avoiding the lights of the dead.

entities.name: The Passage of Cirith Ungol
entities.summary: Frodo and Sam, led by Gollum, pass through Cirith Ungol, where Frodo is stung by Shelob and captured by Orcs.

entities.name: Sam's Rescue of Frodo
entities.summary: Sam fights the Orcs at the Tower of Cirith Ungol and rescues Frodo, taking the Ring for safekeeping.

entities.name: The Battle at the Black Gate
entities.summary: The diversionary assault on the Black Gate by the armies of the West to draw Sauron's eye away from Frodo and Sam.

entities.name: The Destruction of the One Ring
entities.summary: Frodo and Sam reached Mount Doom, and the One Ring was finally destroyed in the fires where it was forged, ending Sauron's power.

entities.name: The Coronation of King Elessar
entities.summary: Aragorn's coronation as King Elessar Telcontar of Gondor and Arnor, the Return of the King.

entities.name: The Quest Begins
entities.summary: The beginning of the Ring's journey, from Bilbo's party through the flight to Rivendell, as the Shadow falls on the Shire.

entities.name: The Fellowship's Journey
entities.summary: The Fellowship's journey from Rivendell through Lothlórien to the breaking at Amon Hen, the great quest to destroy the Ring.

entities.name: The War in the North
entities.summary: The war against Saruman in Rohan, including the rescue of Merry and Pippin, the Ents' attack on Isengard, and the Battle of Helm's Deep.

relationships.targetEntityName: The Capture of Merry and Pippin

entities.name: The Quest to Destroy the Ring
entities.summary: Frodo and Sam's journey through Ithilien and Mordor to destroy the One Ring, guided by Gollum.

relationships.targetEntityName: The Journey through the Dead Marshes
The Destruction of the One Ring

entities.name: The War of the Ring
entities.summary: The great war against Sauron, encompassing all the major battles and events from the Siege of Minas Tirith to the final victory.

relationships.targetEntityName: The Battle at the Black Gate
The Quest to Destroy the Ring

entities.name: The Field of Cormallen
entities.summary: The reunion of the Fellowship and the celebration of victory on the Field of Cormallen in Ithilien.

entities.name: The Return Journey
entities.summary: The Hobbits' journey back to the Shire, passing through Rivendell and Bree, discovering their home has been occupied.

entities.name: The Scouring of the Shire
entities.summary: The Hobbits return to find the Shire under the control of Saruman's ruffians, and lead a rebellion to free it.

entities.name: Frodo's Departure
entities.summary: Frodo, bearing the scars of the Ring, departs Middle-earth with Bilbo, Gandalf, and the Elves, sailing into the West.
